C8FB6C625D9C4DDEBE8344F7B58A8E02.description:
The Virgin Mary is the Church's model for virtue and discipleship. The Theological Virtues and Cardinal Virtues guide our minds
and actions and lead us to a good life.

903E61EB9A2C4F918903597F5BB9CB71.description: The Liturgical Year is based upon the lives of Jesus Christ, Mary and the Saints.

A200DB6B0F434051B2A57165DF041BCD.description: JESUS CHRIST CALLS HIS FOLLOWERS TO A LIFE OF SACRAMENTAL GRACE THROUGH THE LITURGY

4EDBEB6E528D41FA97CF5842D68BDA9B.description:
The Church is a worldwide community with laws for the baptized members to follow. Members have responsibilities and are called
to be active in the Church community.

8AC4352F5EC545C89F011B9EF4BB6E49.description:
The four marks of the Church, that she is one, holy, catholic
and apostolic, define the nature of the Church.

595E4481A4B441C18C5CC2ABDE5176EA.description:
Jesus will come again at the end of the world to judge the living
and the dead.

FFA508F0AD5E454ABB4F8B4D3EBC7704.description:
The Trinity, God the Father, God the Son, and God the Holy
Spirit, is the foundation of all Catholic faith and belief.

A75118A54A50432BAFA72055CF7B0053.description: The Apostles' and Nicene Creeds state what Catholics believe and hold to be true.

3A22227D32F74A399ED01D152E49D887.description: THE CHURCH EXPRESSES HER FUNDAMENTAL BELIEFS IN HER CREEDS

45A13B77A2B7443FADB6FD88DB908672.description: The Beatitudes foster a love and care for the poor in the world.

850FAFBBB1F747F982BD761AEFAFEAD4.description:
Jesus Christ taught the Beatitudes as the guide for living and
a basis for justice in the world.

6DFBE7D36D97407C860C9382BF17683A.description:
When we follow Jesus Christ and live out His teachings in the Beatitudes, we make the Kingdom of God, God's love,
active in the world.

AFE5D531B8DB44E2A3E6AF62800A96E2.description:
The Beatitudes are at the heart of Jesus' preaching and serve as a guide for the Church to build up the Kingdom of God.
The Beatitudes are the foundation for the Kingdom of God.

EDCCE3736AEA405EB721DE44FC8252D1.description: JESUS CHRIST CALLS HIS PEOPLE TO BE FORMED BY THE BEATITUDES

38B88325C414400CAB2E4CA39255255C.description:
You shall not covet your neighbor's wife. You shall not covet
your neighbor's goods. These commandments honor right relationship and boundaries between neighbors and their
possessions. Neighbors are called to respect the sanctity of
marriage and the private property of all.

A3F1E47C77D04917A51CAD1AD3ED2A74.description:
You shall not bear false witness against your neighbor. This commandment calls each person to witness to the truth of
the Gospel in speech and action.

06D766543BD943DB9D9E7AC62CCCAA09.description:
You shall not steal. This commandment honors honesty,
justice and truthful actions.

A1F9AECD02B54A1C8F62FF87BD921509.description:
You shall not commit adultery. This commandment honors the creation of male and female in the inherent dignity and
equality of each.

C37C5F0AB821406DB2E3092112425593.description:
You shall not kill. This commandment honors the God-given
value of life from the moment of conception to natural death.

3BADCBC327574C94AF8FFF26C41DF98D.description:
Honor your father and mother. The fourth commandment calls us to honor and obey those who God has placed in
authority over us for the good.

D916B550971346F1B3B6E9747B982D27.description:
When we follow the fourth through the tenth commandments, we are showing our love and respect for
others.

04820F6374794896AA7E23BB0E4C1894.description: GOD CALLS HIS PEOPLE TO LOVE OF NEIGHBOR THROUGH THE TEN COMMANDMENTS

C9B5509F22A041F9864095C76B2202FE.description:
Remember to keep holy the Lord's Day. The meaning of the Lord's Day is to keep holy the Sabbath by participating in the
Divine Liturgy (The Mass) on Sundays and days of obligation.

F8AADE21480F4ED8998EF9F76C2679FD.description:
You shall not take the name of the Lord, your God, in vain. The second commandment honors God's name, advocates
reverent speech and forbids the abuse of God's name.

FAA4A50C0E50496B9EAE5B93E8A872FB.description:
I am the Lord your God; you shall have not strange gods before me. The first commandment emphasizes the belief in
one God, fostering faith, hope and love {charity) and forbids
the worship of other gods.

954C8ADDFF624900BAF81B9F7645C9E3.description: The Commandments set forth the obligations of living out the covenant between God and man.

FC4D6AF88E7947DF9BB3642808EF19C2.description:
The Ten Commandments are the laws of God's covenant
given to Moses on Mt. Sinai. The first three Commandments concern love of God and the last seven concern love of
neighbor. Jesus Christ sums up the Ten Commandments in
The Great Commandment.

0A63CA0902E14C978A1E44F62F8228E0.description: GOD CALLS HIS PEOPLE TO LIVE IN RELATIONSHIP THROUGH THE TEN COMMANDMENTS

74EA199160F148A5B630BE36A2B9A92B.description:
Reconciliation requires true repentance and making right the harm one has caused. The Ten Commandments are the
framework for the examination of conscience.

16901864FCD1413F9653352B194D945C.description:
n the Sacrament of Reconciliation, sins are forgiven by a priest in the name of Christ and the Church and through the
power of the Holy Spirit.

E7E447398A5F4F7793E992127DC1778A.description:
The Sacrament of Penance and Reconciliation is the means by which the Church continues Jesus' ministry of healing,
forgiveness and love.

2949B6C4448C40018B95DECCD63D9473.description:
The Sacraments strengthen and nourish the life of Christ within us. We are called to lead a sacramental life through frequent
reception of the sacraments of the Eucharist and Reconciliation.

CC1DECD650BC4390BDF7FEA22C38EDE6.description:
The Holy Spirit divinely inspires and guides the Church. Confirmation increases and deepens the Gifts of the Holy Spirit
received at Baptism.

651622877D824D8194157774686250BE.description: Conscience formation is a lifelong process to know the good and is the basis for moral decision-making.

510B5BFE473C42CEA01E1CAA95B2F03B.description: God continually calls us through his conscience to be close to Him, to love goodness and to avoid evil.

28FEFBBD99BC45889398F765D8D17B09.description: God gives each person the gift of conscience.

158A821CF7E946E3AC35891DF029A625.description:
Sin is a deliberate thought, word, deed or omission against the eternal law of God. Sin harms the relationship between
God, self and community.

F7BAC04035C142C59B184C401ABC2730.description: God created man with a free will. Free will is the freedom to choose between right or wrong.

B051C46363EC473596CD8AD21427A05D.description: JESUS CHRIST CALLS ALL PERSONS TO LIVE A MORAL LIFE THROUGH A FORMED CONSCIENCE

5D079A13B3BF4BD7B78C93733207E485.description: Jesus Christ is the model of holiness, teaching His followers to pray and to trust God.

4077421968D1483BBFEAD4B0C87ABDA7.description:
Jesus was sent to show divine love and the goodness of God and
to affirm the human potential for good.

04A6E3AC51C2406DB51B66F0639ED2D0.description:
God revealed Himself through the covenant in the Old Testament. The old covenant is fulfilled and made new in Jesus Christ, the
new covenant.

1535354B35224971B1F34E07B7779B05.description:
Jesus Christ is the Son of God who was sent to redeem the
world. Jesus Christ's life and teachings lead man to God.

D6310A11DDF14DAF9AC426A04D710218.description: JESUS CHRIST IS THE MORAL GUIDE

2B4FBDC4C66B4A9A995501E40C79E4CA.description: Faith Theme: Jesus Calls Us to Follow the Beatitudes and the Ten Commandments

172456C8869C472EBEF1A840D18830F6.description: Corporal and Spiritual Works of Mercy

FC9CB4D3AA9947D9A0779AD9998AA910.description: The Liturgical year is based upon the lives of Jesus Christ, Mary and the Saints.

E3EDD6BC840D4BA4B8D4757C6421FCE3.description: JESUS CHRIST CALLS HIS FOLLOWERS TO A LIFE OF SACRAMENTAL GRACE THROUGH LITURGY.

14B512773AB849F5ACBC81E6CA1A7F87.description: The four marks of the Church, that she is one, holy, catholic and apostolic, define the nature of the Church.

16226238453144439D954FFB2A4C3B4C.description: The Apostles' and Nicene Creeds state what Catholics believe and hold to be true.

745BDB2870864A0DBB4B5A4B518720C2.description: THE CHURCH EXPRESSES HER FUNDAMENTAL BELIEFS IN HER CREEDS.

1C7C56AE609B452A854116D23F57CDB1.description: The Beatitudes foster a love and care for the poor in the world.

D331B2CD2FEC4D6A8826A8D9E39FE402.description: Jesus Christ taught the Beatitudes as the guide for living and a basis for justice in the world.

D3870572F1594742B28872B9BBD1FDDF.description: When we follow Jesus Christ and live out His teachings in the Beatitudes, we make the Kingdom of God, God's love, active in the world.

86050C9E4B464D81BE8161BA42284840.description: The Beatitudes are at the heart of Jesus' preaching and serve as a guide for the Church to build up the Kingdom of God. The Beatitudes are the foundation for the Kingdom of God.

83581E59E9EB43769250597DAE8215C4.description: JESUS CHRIST CALLS HIS PEOPLE TO BE FORMED BY THE BEATITUDES

You shall not covet your neighbor's goods. These commandments honor right relationship and boundaries between neighbors and their possessions. Neighbors are called to respect the sanctity of marriage and the private property of all.
